title: Sans on New Orleans Signage
content:
This is a bit of - I think - old signage in New Orleans, LA. I've gotten close on a couple of ID tries, but not exactly. Any ideas?  
Thanks!

--Chuck

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [NO Sign.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725152359/http:/typophile.com/files/NO%20Sign.jpg) | 356.5 KB |
author: ChuckGroth

comments.content: The M suggests that the sign is based on Futura Extrabold, although it's not an absolutely exact match.

Futura is good start but too many details look way off to me (/R, flat /G right side, /G and /S angled cut terminals...). Unfortunately, can't either name it or state if it's a custom lettering. Some alternatives I gathered during my search: [Agenda](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725152359/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/agenda) FB, [Mixage](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725152359/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/mixage) ITC, [Whitney](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725152359/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/whitney/overview) HTF, [Swank Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725152359/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bagraphics/swank-gothic) BA (not bad), [Solitaire](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725152359/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mvbfonts/mvb-solitaire-pro) MVB, **[Equip](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725152359/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hoftype/equip)** HT (far too recent but possibly the closest)  
Quick'n'dirty' job, a retracing of the signage

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725152359im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-1_4097.png)
